title: 2014 Audi R18 e-tron: Audi’s Infamous Diesel-Hybrid Tested! - Ignition Ep. 125

comments.text:
I could watch Randy do his own show man, he's so chill haha and you can see 
he knows what he's talking about when he's driven the cars and it's purely 
from a track perspective. Which is great! It annoys me having all these 
guys going on a track to drive a street car goin ooooh this cars 0.2 
seconds quicker on the track and it goes sideways boss. Yea but 99.8% of 
the people buying them will never see a track so er what's it actually like 
as car to drive on the road. Randy's assestments on track are great because 
it's all about how it feels and the cars actual dynamics no BS based on 
brand preference etc. Not sure where that rant came from lol﻿

comments.author: DeltaPhi79

comments.text:
Yep the Audi R18 E tron is great.But I thought the 3.7 V6 TDI got 510hp and 
625lb/ft of torque?? The inlet is around 45.8mm which cost maybe 5% power 
off. The turbo boost must set at 2 bar. It's actually a RWD, the front 
wheel will power up at 120+km/h and the fly wheels gain 500kj of energy and 
spin at 45,000 rpm. The E motor will generate up to 200+hp in my memory. It 
uses a system called MGC and it'll recharge whenever the driver brakes. For 
me, I think the 610hp TFSI V8 is better. 100 bar injection force and 8% 
better in terms of fuel economy which gain 1 more lap per tank. Audi build 
good race cars but can't build good track cars :( Actually, I think Audi's 
motors are far better than both Gallardo and Huracan V10. R8 should quit 
using those V10s and start using there own TFSI. ﻿

comments.text:
+Trades46 承認 my ass. Lets go deep. FSI stands for fuel stratified 
injection. or 燃油分層噴射 to make you clarify. Let use R8 as an example, it 
inject fuel at a 100 bar high pressure for a more equally burn and fuel 
eco. The point is, TFSI is just a FSI with Turbo and the reason I said B7 
RS4 is a TFSI 4.2 V8 is because MTM is Audi's tuner like G Power is 
Bimmer's tuner or Brabus. If you still think you're right, lets greek about 
the tuning chips.

comments.author: SenszR

comments.text:
+LAUNCH CONTROL 東瀛戰神 I've read somewhere ever since 2014 Audi has changed 
the motor to a 4.0 V6 TDI engine due to a change in regulations of the 
LMP1-H class - engine size restriction has been cancelled. Toyota also took 
that time to swap the TS030's 3.4 V8 engine to a 3.7 V8 in the TS040.The 
LMP1-L (the Rebellion R-One) is still restricted to a 5.5 liter engine 
however.
